topic: Deep dive: webbrowser standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: webbrowser standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: Webbrowser Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer provides an overview of the Webbrowser module, a built-in standard library in Python 3.12+, which allows for easy interaction between your Python script and web browsers.
key_points: The Webbrowser module offers a simple way to open URLs within various web browsers.
It supports several popular browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Internet Explorer, and Opera.
The module uses the operating system's default browser for opening URLs when no specific browser is specified.
Python 3.12+ includes improvements and updates to the Webbrowser module.
version_notes: Python 3.12+ introduces new features and improvements to the Webbrowser module, such as supporting more browsers.
Always ensure you're using the latest version of Python for accessing the most up-to-date functionality.
caveats: Some browser configurations may prevent automatic opening via scripts.
The available browsers can vary depending on your operating system and browser versions.
